title: What is the rate percent per annum if a sum doubles itself in 17 years at compound interest? - Quora

response.answer_text: You have not mentioned the compounding period as that will effect the rate. However it will be between the annual i.e. 1x compounding per year to the continuous compound rate. 1x compound rate 2=(1+r(1))^17 take natural logs of both sides and arrange ln(2)=17*ln(1+r1) r1=e(ln(2)/17)-1 r1=4.1616% Continuous compounding 2=e^(17*rc) rc=ln(2)/17=4.077%

Let p be the principal. Then: 2p=p(1+r)^17 , where r is the nominal rate of interest So: 2=(1+r)^17 ln 2=ln (1+r)^17 =17 ln (1+r) ln (1+r)=0.040773363562349724 e^ln (1+r)=1+r=e^0.040773363562349724 1+r=1.041616 r=0.041616 or 4.1616% interest….
